criteria: Understanding of the Benefits of Positive Alternatives
Application of Alternatives in Real-Life Scenarios
descriptions: Does not identify any alternatives to alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs.
Identifies one alternative with no explanation.
Identifies one alternative with a limited explanation.
Identifies two alternatives with basic explanations.
Identifies three alternatives with clear explanations.
Identifies multiple (3+) alternatives with detailed explanations and examples of how to implement them.
Shows no understanding of the benefits of choosing positive alternatives.
Demonstrates a limited understanding of one benefit.
Describes one benefit with some clarity.
Describes two benefits with reasonable clarity.
Explains three benefits clearly and accurately.
Clearly and accurately explains multiple benefits, including physical, mental, and social well-being.
Unable to apply alternatives to real-life scenarios involving the use of alcohol, tobacco, or other drugs.
Suggests an alternative that is impractical or unsafe in a given scenario.
Suggests a single, somewhat relevant alternative to a scenario.
Suggests two relevant alternatives to a scenario.
Suggests multiple relevant alternatives and explains their effectiveness.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding by suggesting multiple alternatives and adapting them effectively to various complex scenarios.
